body:
They are all generated by 'pg_config', they should not be relative PATH. 

ifndef PG_CONFIG
PG_CONFIG = pg_config
endif

bindir := $(shell $(PG_CONFIG) --bindir)
datadir := $(shell $(PG_CONFIG) --sharedir)
sysconfdir := $(shell $(PG_CONFIG) --sysconfdir)
libdir := $(shell $(PG_CONFIG) --libdir)
pkglibdir := $(shell $(PG_CONFIG) --pkglibdir)
includedir := $(shell $(PG_CONFIG) --includedir)
pkgincludedir := $(shell $(PG_CONFIG) --pkgincludedir)
mandir := $(shell $(PG_CONFIG) --mandir)
docdir := $(shell $(PG_CONFIG) --docdir)
localedir := $(shell $(PG_CONFIG) --localedir)
OK, so +1.
@ictmalili @linwen @stanlyxiang help to review, thanks!
@edespino, @shivzone, @denalex, @radarwave, @paul-guo-, please review. Thanks.

May need to add one more file:
tools/bin/gppylib/data/2.2.json (can copy from tools/bin/gppylib/data/2.1.json)
@radarwave, right. We need that file for catalog.
This PR is closed for not valid any more.
Merged into code master branch.
merged
We CAN copy when catalog not changed. But better to GENERATE the version.json file.
@stanlyxiang, you are right. The json need to be consistently for corresponding hawq version.

The 2.1 json file is created based on hawq 2.1.0.0-incubating code base and instruction at https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/HAWQ/Build+and+Install.
```
cd src/include/catalog/
perl tidycat.pl -dd 2.1.json -df json *.h
mv 2.1.json ../../../tools/bin/gppylib/data/2.1.json
```
The json file has been updated based on latest code base.
LGTM  +1

Does this fixed below issue? Apache hawq rpm name should be 'apache-hawq', not 'hawq_2_2_0_0'.

rpm -ivh hawq-ranger-plugin_2_2_0_0-2.2.0.0-1.el7.centos.noarch.rpm
error: Failed dependencies:
	hawq_2_2_0_0 >= 2.2.0.0 is needed by hawq-ranger-plugin_2_2_0_0-2.2.0.0-1.el7.centos.noarch
No. The dependency on hawq needs to change to apache-hawq or must be excluded in branch for the open source binary build.

(1) no file in master branch: src/test/unit/mock/backend/commands/analyze_mock.c
(2) Do we run CI on these mock test now? 
(3) Because it's hard to reproduce this bug,  we don't know how to trigger it in the sql test.
+1 Thanks for working on this quickly.
@ljainpivotalio So we need another jira to fix the dependence issue?

LGTM now, +1

Thanks lav!
LGTM

@radarwave The open source build can override these values using maven command line:

BUILD_OPTS="-Drelease.version=bin -Dbuild.suffix= -Dhawq.dep.name=apache-hawq  -Ddestination.dir=/usr/local/apache-hawq/ranger"

Now hawq ranger plugin rpm is in different directory, we should update the  tarball script 'contrib/hawq-package/make_rpm_tarball.sh' with the new copy directory:

-cp ${SRC_TOP_DIR}/ranger-plugin/target/rpm/hawq-ranger-plugin_*/RPMS/noarch/hawq-ranger-plugin*.rpm ${RPM_PKG_DIR}/
+cp ${SRC_TOP_DIR}/ranger-plugin/target/rpm/hawq-ranger-plugin*/RPMS/noarch/hawq-ranger-plugin*.rpm ${RPM_PKG_DIR}/

Now the rpm name is: hawq-ranger-plugin-2.2.0.0-1.el7.centos.noarch.rpm

How about we remove the string 'centos' since there is already a 'el7' string there?

After set "export HD=hdp", the rpm package names changed back with the version string "3_2_1_0". Maybe this is expected. But then I still seeing it requires Apache Hadoop. See:

`rpm -ivh pxf-service_3_2_1_0-3.2.1.0-1.el6.noarch.rpm
error: Failed dependencies:
	hadoop >= 2.7.1 is needed by pxf-service_3_2_1_0-0:3.2.1.0-1.el6.noarch
	hadoop-hdfs >= 2.7.1 is needed by pxf-service_3_2_1_0-0:3.2.1.0-1.el6.noarch`

Can you please provide me the output of sudo yum list installed | grep hadoop
If this was hdp distribution, hadoop-hdfs rpms should have already been installed or been available in some repo
[gpadmin@test1 ~]$ rpm -qR hadoop-hdfs.noarch
hadoop_2_5_0_0_1245-hdfs

sudo yum list installed | grep hadoop
hadoop-conf-pseudo.noarch        2.7.3.2.5.0.0-1245.el6     @HDP-2.5.0.0
hadoop_2_5_0_0_1245.x86_64       2.7.3.2.5.0.0-1245.el6     @HDP-2.5.0.0
hadoop_2_5_0_0_1245-conf-pseudo.x86_64
hadoop_2_5_0_0_1245-hdfs.x86_64  2.7.3.2.5.0.0-1245.el6     @HDP-2.5.0.0
hadoop_2_5_0_0_1245-hdfs-datanode.x86_64
hadoop_2_5_0_0_1245-hdfs-namenode.x86_64
hadoop_2_5_0_0_1245-hdfs-secondarynamenode.x86_64

hadoop_2_5_0_0_1245-yarn-nodemanager.x86_64
hadoop_2_5_0_0_1245-yarn-resourcemanager.x86_64

rpm -qR hadoop-hdfs.noarch
package hadoop-hdfs.noarch is not installed

@radarwave looks like you have installed the HDP rpms without using the virtual rpms. Products that depend on hdp will only have a dependancy on their virtual rpms as it is close to impossible to keep track of the exact build number of hadoop as part of the dependancy.

hadoop virutal rpm will be hadoop-hdfs which will have a dependancy on the physical rpm hadoop_2_5_0_0_1245-hdfs. Hope this fixes your issue.
Do you plan to add any unit tests ?

@shivzone sure, added unit-tests.
+1 for the improving cmock

After investigation, it seems we can not use cmock to reproduce HAWQ-1417.

The reason is: we need to mock all functions called in these functions, and also we need make one relation with catalog in memory, and data on disk.

I looked into some unit tests exists in backend, all tests are testing simple logic, and calling some independent modules, so the functions need to be mocked is very limited.
+1 for the fix as the mock of the verification is not feasible
+1 for the fix

Feature-test failed when _TestHawqRanger.PXF*_ tests run parallelly(other ranger tests run serially). Seems they conflict with _TestHawqRanger.Deny*_ tests.

So I rebased sanity_tests.txt, all ranger tests still run serially in this PR, and I will open a new Jira to parallel them in future.
Now ranger pxf tests are running parallelly, I have tested.
Merged into master. Close this PR.
